user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_fs_grow_:
```c
static int lfs_fs_grow_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_size_t block_count) {
    int err;

    if (block_count == lfs->block_count) {
        return 0;
    }

    
#ifndef LFS_SHRINKNONRELOCATING
    // shrinking is not supported
    LFS_ASSERT(block_count >= lfs->block_count);
#endif
#ifdef LFS_SHRINKNONRELOCATING
    if (block_count < lfs->block_count) {
        err = lfs_fs_traverse_(lfs, lfs_shrink_checkblock, &block_count, true);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }
#endif

    lfs->block_count = block_count;

    // fetch the root
    lfs_mdir_t root;
    err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &root, lfs->root);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // update the superblock
    lfs_superblock_t superblock;
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_get(lfs, &root, LFS_MKTAG(0x7ff, 0x3ff, 0),
            LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_INLINESTRUCT, 0, sizeof(superblock)),
            &superblock);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return tag;
    }
    lfs_superblock_fromle32(&superblock);

    superblock.block_count = lfs->block_count;

    lfs_superblock_tole32(&superblock);
    err = lfs_dir_commit(lfs, &root, LFS_MKATTRS(
            {tag, &superblock}));
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
lfs_superblock_tole32(&superblock);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in this fragment: the call lfs_superblock_tole32(&superblock) itself does not use any functions from <string.h>, so Rule 21.17 is not violated here. A violationscenario would be if the implementation of lfs_superblock_tole32 used a string handling function (e.g. memcpy/memmove/strcpy) and copied more bytes than sizeof(lfs_superblock_t) (for example memcpy(&superblock, src, sizeof(lfs_superblock_t) + N)), which would breach Rule 21.17. Inspect lfs_superblock_tole32’s implementation to ensure it does not perform out‑of‑bounds string/memory operations.
